intro: Simirestis mouilensis, commonly known as the Mouil Forest Begonia, is a rare and endemic species native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing along forest floor under a dense canopy. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical flora and conservation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and deforestation.
